item.description:
Holiday Open House
Saturday, December 3, 2011

10:00 a.m.-4:00 p.m.

In the Millyard Museum

FREE Admission - No RSVP is required - just come

Please note: Manchester’s annual Spirit of New Hampshire Christmas Parade starts at 4 p.m. Park at the Millyard Museum and walk up to Elm Street after the Holiday Open House!

Members of the Manchester Historic Association will receive an EXTRA 10% discount on purchases made during the Holiday Open House (20% instead of the normal 10%).
　
Enjoy a fun day with family, friends and neighbors!

10:00 a.m.-4:00 p.m. – Premiere of "The Great Flood of 1936" slideshow featuring historical photos from the Manchester Historic Association collection (This will run throughout the day, along with the 1937 "March of Time" newsreel, "Amoskeag.")

10:00 a.m.-1:00 p.m. – Try riding a Segway! Segway of Manchester will be offering FREE machine demos in the Elm Street Gallery.
　
10:00 a.m.-3:30 p.m. – Steve Pearson will sign his book "Manchester Firefighting."
　
10:30-11:45 a.m. – Guided Tour of the Millyard Museum
　
1:00-2:00 p.m. – Presentation of "Streets of Manchester" music video and short talk by local songwriter Michael Shaughnessy & videographer David DeArville. The video features historical photographs from the Manchester Historic Association collection.

View the video on YouTube:   http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kIwVdSVqgZc/

2:15-3:30 p.m. – Guided Tour of the Millyard Museum

Play old-fashioned board games & win free prizes by completing an educational Gallery Hunt.
　
Cookies & cider

Holiday Shopping in the Museum Shop featuring the new brass ornament:
"City Hall." (See this and other ornaments available on this Meetup website – click on “Photos” above.)


﻿
item.name: Holiday Open House
